page.title: 10Communications Ref 02760084
page.content: The majority of the population possesses one or more telephones. Farmers often have an outside bell to facilitate incoming calls. A public call_box is sited at Doccombe.Emerg_ ency calls to the police,fire_service and ambulance are available by dial_ ing 999. Information such as weather, recipes,time and bedtime stories can also be obtained. Repairs are quickly effected. National and International calls to a hundred and twenty countries overseas can be made by direct dialling. The transatlantic cable runs under_ ground along the main B3212 road. The post is delivered twice daily by van,and the postman will collect letters and parcels from isolated dwellings. There is no Post Office but two post boxes _ one at Doccombe and one on the Bovey Tracey road.
